landing-1.title: Muhammad al-Khwarizmi’s Legacy
landing-1.description: A completely free educational program specially designed for students in grades 7–11, offering modern, high-quality knowledge in relevant fields such as logistics, business management, and advanced technologies. The project aims to prepare the younger generation for the demands of the digital age by creating extensive opportunities to enhance their knowledge and skills.
landing-1.carouselAlt: Educational opportunities in the IT field

landing-2.title: IT Town
landing-2.description: This project is designed for talented young people living in remote rural areas of Uzbekistan. It identifies those interested in modern information technologies and provides them with free training in IT skills, foreign languages, and in-demand professions to unlock their potential.
landing-2.carouselAlt: Educational opportunities in the IT field

landing-3.title: IT Talents
landing-3.description: A project launched to train and support qualified specialists in the export of IT services. Non-governmental educational institutions can receive a one-time subsidy of up to 105 times the base calculation amount.
landing-3.carouselAlt: Educational opportunities in the IT field

landing-4.title: One Million Uzbek Developers
landing-4.description: A major educational initiative that provides the youth of Uzbekistan with the opportunity to secure a prominent place in the digital world by offering free education in IT and modern technologies.
landing-4.carouselAlt: Educational opportunities in the IT field

landing-5.title: ToT - The Training of Trainers
landing-5.description: By organizing online training sessions to teach IT mentors at educational centers modern professions, the opportunity is created to enhance their knowledge and skills in the most in-demand fields.
landing-5.carouselAlt: Educational opportunities in the IT field

landing-6.title: Job&Edu Fest
landing-6.description: This platform offers young people, students, and graduates interested in the IT field the opportunity to secure employment, undertake internships, and identify their professional direction. The event features major local and international IT companies operating in our country, higher education institutions, and training centers.
landing-6.carouselAlt: Educational opportunities in the IT field

landing-7.title: “ICT4Girls” – the Informatics Olympiad for schoolgirls in Uzbekistan.
landing-7.description: A project to boost schoolgirls’ interest in competitive programming, develop their knowledge and skills, and prepare them for international informatics olympiads.
landing-7.carouselAlt: Educational opportunities in the IT field

landing-8.title: ACA Navigator
landing-8.description: A course that offers free online instruction in Python programming fundamentals and provides the opportunity to learn about high-demand professional specializations.
landing-8.carouselAlt: Educational opportunities in the IT field

landing-9.title: APIO – Asia-Pacific Informatics Olympiad
landing-9.description: APIO – the Asia–Pacific Informatics Olympiad – is a prestigious programming competition in competitive programming held among students from countries in the Asia–Pacific region.
landing-9.carouselAlt: Educational opportunities in the IT field

landing-10.title: ICPC Uzbekistan Olympiad
landing-10.description: An Olympiad in competitive programming held among students, where the winning teams earn the opportunity to participate in the semifinals of the prestigious ICPC competition.
landing-10.carouselAlt: Educational opportunities in the IT field

events3.description: On May 24, 2025, the DevOpsDays international forum will take place in Tashkent. Specialists from around 10 foreign countries are expected to participate and share their knowledge.

higherStandingOptimization.text: By Decree No. PF-269 of December 24, 2022, of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan 'On Measures to Implement the Administrative Reforms of New Uzbekistan,' the Ministry of Digital Technologies was established on the basis of the former Ministry for the Development of Information Technologies and Communications. The principal tasks and directions of the Ministry's work are as follows: Ensure implementation of a unified state policy in the field of information technologies and communications and in the rollout of 'e-government.' Develop and execute comprehensive programs for applying and advancing the national information and communication system in line with world-class IT standards. Further develop and modernize telecommunications infrastructure, including expanding broadband Internet access; ensure full transition of telephony, television, and radio broadcasting to digital systems; and carry out state functions of managing, licensing, and controlling communications activities and use of the radio-frequency spectrum. Coordinate across ministries, agencies, companies, organizations, and local government bodies to implement state programs for e-government, monitor, evaluate, and control their progress; and establish a unified system for the creation, storage, and use of state information resources and databases, as well as the development and management of interdepartmental information systems. Promote the further formation of the national segment of the Internet; create the technical and ergonomic conditions necessary to develop modern domestic web resources in various fields, meeting the information and intellectual needs of the population—especially the younger generation. Support and coordinate production of competitive software products within the country, foster their domestic market and related services, and drive the adoption of modern software solutions, information systems, and resources in the real sectors of the economy and among consumers. Implement measures to ensure information security and to apply modern protection technologies for communication networks, software products, information systems, and resources; and further develop the technical infrastructure for safeguarding information assets. Organize scientific research and development in modern communication tools; oversee training, retraining, and professional development of personnel; and support the design and implementation of software products, information systems, and databases, as well as information-security initiatives and related ICT projects. Establish international cooperation in communications and information-technology fields; carry out priority projects; and attract foreign investment for efficient use of the radio-frequency spectrum and other activities within the Ministry's remit.

director.title: Director
director.description: Since February 10, 2025, he has been serving as the Director of the Center for the Development of Digital Education under the Ministry of Digital Technologies. Azamat Eshankulov has extensive experience in digital technologies...
director.fullDescription: Since February 10, 2025, he has been serving as the Director of the Center for the Development of Digital Education under the Ministry of Digital Technologies. Azamat Eshankulov has extensive experience in digital technologies and has successfully implemented a number of important projects. Throughout his career, he has promoted innovative ideas for the development and digitalization of the modern education system.

Throughout his career, he has promoted innovative ideas for the development and digitalization of the modern education system.

description: This is the hidden part of the software that users cannot see but ensures the functioning of an application or website. Backend works with databases, implements business logic, and interacts with the user interface (frontend).
project_description: The 'Al-Khwarizmi Heirs' project provides free English and IT lessons for students in grades 7-11.
project_details: The 'Muhammad al-Khwarizmi Heirs' project aims to prepare students for high-demand careers in the labor market.
project_goal: By 2028, this system will be implemented nationwide in three stages, resulting in 50,000 skilled graduates ready for the job market.
study_title: Want to study for free at Al-Khwarizmi?
study_description: Join the waiting list for the next admission!

hero.title: "IT Talents" Program
hero.description: The "IT Talents" program provides a one-time subsidy system of up to 75 times the base calculation amount when a graduate of a non-governmental educational institution is employed in an IT service-exporting organization, and up to 105 times when a graduate with a disability is employed in such an organization.

decisions.title: Program-related decisions
decisions.document1: Decree No. PQ-51 of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated February 1, 2024, "On additional measures to support the activities of training qualified specialists in the field of digitalization"
decisions.document2: Decree No. 86 of the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated February 12, 2024, "On measures to support the activities of training qualified specialists in the field of IT services export"
